tr.th: Read different sourcing about ecological, social, economic and political issues at local, national, and global levels, recognizing how they contribute to global challenges

When encountering a problem (e.g., poverty, climate change), consistently seek to understand its underlying causes in discussions or actions, focus on systematic solutions that can create widespread, positive change, rather than isolated fixes.
Actively volunteer time or support organizations working systematically on sustainable development and poverty eradication, education, health in disadvantaged regions.
Voting after thoughtful research into political parties, candidates, and their policiesâ€”and choosing based on ethical principles.
Participate in public discourses, hold political representative accountable, meet regularly with civil society representatives.
Actively support and participate in local or international organizations or movements working for global issues such as human rights, global justice, women empowerment etc.
Avoid overconsumption, prioritize durable and recyclable items. Promote local items and prefer sharing.
Buy from companies who truly support undeveloped communities and adhere to ethical practices including environmental sustainability across their global supply chains.

Take care of animal welfare by avoiding mass factory-farmed animal or similar practices. Use alternatives to leather, rejecting entertainment that hurts animals. Advocate and participate in animal right compaigns.
Use renewable energy sources such as solar, wind, and hydroelectric power compared to fossil fuels.
Reduce CO2 footprint through energy efficient appliances and environment friendly transportation and solutions.
Contribute to environmental projects through volunteering or resources such as forestation, conservation, clean water initiatives etc.
Create inner peace by mediatation, sports, thankfulness, purposeful work and quality ethical relationships. Actions shall be guided by deep moral conviction rather than egosim or vanity.

Use empathetic and respectful communication to resolve personal or group disagreements, avoiding escalation, bring opposing sides together, listen carefully to opinions or fears of others to find common ground.

Contribute to foundation and expansion of resilient local and international communities for peace and conflict resolving, volunteer efforts to address challenges, keep active network, exchange ideas and share resources.
Travel and engage with different cultures and belief systems, going beyond surface-level observations or media headlines.
Understand how your own cultural background can bias or influence your views, seek knowledge and build respectful relationships.
Actively solve problems and work to make communities more inclusive and fair such as speaking out against racism, discrimination, or xenophobia.
